subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Sara Blakely: Inventing Spanx With $5,000
description: A 60-second lesson on Sara Blakely: Inventing Spanx With $5,000.

hook.text: Sara Blakely cut the feet off her pantyhose to look smoother in white pants. A billion-dollar idea.

buildup.text: With $5,000 and no fashion experience, she wrote her own patent and cold-called manufacturers.

discovery.text: Every manufacturer rejected her. One called backâ€”his daughters told him it was a good idea.

twist.text: Blakely never took outside investment. She owns 100% of Spanx and became the youngest self-made female billionaire.

climax.text: Oprah named Spanx a 'Favorite Thing' in 2000. Orders exploded overnight.

punchline.text: The best ideas solve problems you live with every day.

quiz.question: What was Sara Blakely's key advantage in building Spanx?
options: She experienced the problem personally and bootstrapped without giving up ownership
She had extensive experience in the fashion industry
She received a large inheritance to fund the business
